project_abstract.cdata: The Labor Market Development Project will contribute to an enabling environment for state-owned enterprise (SOE) reforms and promote China's transition to a market economy. The objectives of this four-year pilot project are to: 1) support policy and legal reforms to facilitate the development of functioning labor markets and promote urban labor mobility; 2) improve the delivery of labor market services, and training to facilitate the redeployment of, surplus workers in SOEs, the unemployed, and rural-to-urban migrant labor and thus increase labor productivity and mobility; and 3) enhance the institutional capacity of project implementing agencies with a view to promoting market-based services. The components of the project are: 1) policy reform on the coverage and pooling of social insurance at the municipal level, reduction of surplus labor in SOEs, and the monetization of social benefits by employers; 2) employment services on job waiting time, improved administrative and accounting procedures and timely payment of unemployment insurance, and improved labor market information and dissemination; 3) inservice training on placement rates and earnings; and 4) institutional development on improved services to job seekers and employers, and improved resource allocation for training based on market signals.

P034618.projectinfo: <![CDATA[<Project><LangCode>ZH</LangCode><ProjectName>劳动力市场发展项目</ProjectName><ProjectAbstract>本项目为四年期试点项目，将协助营造有利于国有企业改革的良好环境，促进中国向市场经济转型。项目目标是：（1）支持政策和法制改革，促进建立运作良好的劳动力市场，促进城市劳动力流动；（2）改进劳动力市场服务，提供培训，促进国有企业下岗职工、失业人群和农民工重新安置，进而提高劳动生产率和劳动力流动水平；（3）提升项目执行机构的能力，促进市场化服务。项目设有以下内容：（1）市级社会保险覆盖和共保政策改革、国有企业剩余劳动力裁减、用人单位社会效益货币化；（2）提供待业期就业服务，完善管理和会计核算程序，及时支付失业保险金，完善劳动力市场信息和传播系统；（3）失业期培训；（4）开展制度建设，以改进对求职者和用人单位的服务，根据市场信号改进对培训的资源分配。</ProjectAbstract></Project>]]>
